person.name: Wyatt Kirby
person.title: Founding Partner
person.bio:
An accidental developer, Wyatt came to software and small business by an
unconventional route. As a cofounder at Apsis, he has helped build a team of
exceptional engineers, one equipped to deliver effective solutions fast.
After more than a decade, Wyatt _keeps_ coming back to software because it
offers a rare convergence of interests: writing, teaching, and tech.
A graduate of Bennington College in Vermont, Wyatt's appreciation for clear
communication has come to define Apsis's engineering team: understanding first,
technology second. This focus leads to asking the right questions, finding the
right answers, and delivering success year after year.


After work, you'll find Wyatt enjoying time with his wife and daughter, playing
with the cat, roasting coffee, cooking dinner, or arguing on the internet about
college football.
person.bio_short:
An accidental developer turned entrepreneur, Wyatt has helped build a team of exceptional
engineers at Apsis. After a decade in the field, he continues to be drawn to software for
its blend of writing, teaching, and tech.

posts.author: wyatt
posts.title: Be easy to fire
posts.excerpt: At Apsis, we’re not afraid of being let go — in fact, we want it. Our goal is to help clients grow and succeed, and eventually move on. We operate on simple principles: transparency, simplicity, and clear communication. When it’s time to say goodbye, we’re here to make the handoff smooth and seamless.

person.name: Chris Pfohl
person.title: Senior Engineer & Data Engineer
person.bio:
Chris is an expert data mover, munger, and analyzer. He builds robust third
party integrations, answers tough questions with data, and brings order to
databases and applications to empower new features and higher reliability.


Chris loves to share his expertise with newer developers through code
review, teaching, and good documentation. He also loves writing code that's
hard to use wrong and creating tools that empower his team to deliver faster
and more reliably. He was drawn to programming, and contract work in
particular because of his deep love of learning, solving problems, and
sharing that knowledge.
person.bio_short:
A master data mover and analyzer, Chris crafts robust integrations and sorts
through complexity with ease. He loves sharing his expertise through code review,
teaching, and rock-solid documentation.

person.name: Eric Greer
person.title: Senior Engineer & Devops Specialist
person.bio:
Eric is a full stack software developer with a passion for DevOps. Working
with the nuances of AWS, he has worked move large clients and small into the
cloud architecture that is right for them, automating deployments and
ensuring applications stability. Eric has a B.S and M.S. in Computer Science
from WPI, a background in IT support, combined with 15 years of software
development projects which gives him an attention to detail and makes him a
go to resource for any questions a client may have. Eric finds passion
learning the nuances of each business and is always excited to tackle the
next challenging project.

person.name: Noah Callaway
person.title: Founding Partner
person.bio:
For over 10 years, Noah has been the technical backbone of the Apsis
engineering team. In stark contrast to his cofounder, Noah's history is
about as textbook as it gets: CS classes at the University of Oregon while
still in high school, BS from the University of Washington with
specialization in physics and computer science, a stint at Microsoft, a tour
at Amazon, and for the last decade plus, serving as Apsis's lead engineer
and architect. Noah's drive for building the technically correct solution is
balanced by his decade of experience running Apsis Labs, where his focus is on
outcome-driven-development: finding the solution that delivers 90% of the value
at 10% of the effort.


Outside of work, you'll find Noah with his wife, dog, and two young children;
or you'll find him working, but this time on a new GUI layout engine in Rust or
perhaps trying to get his video drivers to work correctly — he runs Linux after
all.
person.bio_short:
For over a decade, Noah has led Apsis' engineering team with technical expertise.
His background is textbook: CS degree from UW, time at Microsoft and Amazon, and
now 10+ years as Apsis' lead engineer and architect.

posts.author: noah
posts.title: Communicating Software Estimates
posts.excerpt: Communication is hard. It’s also extremely important. We’re lucky that in the field of software development miscommunication tends to lead to project delays instead of loss of life. Estimates are also hard. It’s challenging to produce accurate estimates in the first place, but even after a good estimate has been produced, comes the challenging work of communicating the estimates to interested parties.

person.name: Henry Keiter
person.title: Senior Engineer & 1400 ELO
person.bio:
Henry is an imported Coloradan who views software development as a window
into everyone else's fields. Every industry has fascinating hurdles that are
completely unknown to the outside world, and software allows us to build a catapult
to hurl ourselves over them, if we take the time to map the terrain first.
Learning the landscape from domain experts is always a rich experience.
Delivering a catapult that meets their actual needs is a fitting reward.


Beyond the office, you'll find Henry reading, gardening, or playing strategy
games with family. Any physical catapults in the backyard are strictly
coincidental.
person.bio_short:
An imported Coloradan, Henry sees software as a tool to bridge industries.
He loves collaborating with domain experts to map the terrain, then building
solutions that meet their real-world needs.
